identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study of Tebapivat (AG-946) in Participants With Anemia Due to Lower-Risk Myelodysplastic Syndromes (LR-MDS)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 2a/2b, Open-label, Proof of Concept (Phase 2a) and Open-label (Phase 2b), Multicenter, Efficacy, and Safety Study of AG-946 in Participants With Anemia Due to Lower-Risk Myelodysplastic Syndromes

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This purpose of this study is to establish proof of concept of tebapivat in participants with LR-MDS in Phase 2a and to evaluate the effect of tebapivat on transfusion independence (TI) in participants with LR-MDS in phase 2b.

armGroups.label: Core Period: Phase 2a - Tebapivat 5 mg
armGroups.description: Participants will receive 5 milligrams (mg) tebapivat orally, once daily for up to 16 weeks. At the discretion of the investigator, participants who complete the Core Period will be eligible to receive the same dose in Extension Period for up to 156 weeks.

armGroups.label: Core Period: Phase 2b - Tebapivat 10 mg
armGroups.description: Participants will receive 10 mg tebapivat, orally, once daily for up to 24 weeks. At the discretion of the investigator, participants who complete the Core Period will be eligible to receive the same dose in Extension Period for up to 156 weeks.

armGroups.label: Core Period: Phase 2b - Tebapivat 15 mg
armGroups.description: Participants will receive 15 mg tebapivat, orally, once daily for up to 24 weeks. At the discretion of the investigator, participants who complete the Core Period will be eligible to receive the same dose in Extension Period for up to 156 weeks.

armGroups.label: Core Period: Phase 2b - Tebapivat 20 mg
armGroups.description: Participants will receive 20 mg tebapivat, orally, once daily for up to 24 weeks. At the discretion of the investigator, participants who complete the Core Period will be eligible to receive the same dose in Extension Period for up to 156 weeks.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2a: Proportion of Participants With Hemoglobin (Hb) Response
primaryOutcomes.description: Hb response is defined as a ≥1.5-grams per deciliter (g/dL) increase from baseline in the average Hb concentration from Week 8 through Week 16.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2a: Proportion of Participants With Transfusion Independence During the Core Period
primaryOutcomes.description: Transfusion Independence is defined as transfusion-free for ≥8 consecutive weeks during the Core Period (participants With Low Transfusion Burden \[LTB\] only).

primaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2b: Proportion of Participants With Transfusion Independence
primaryOutcomes.description: Transfusion independence, defined as transfusion-free for ≥8 consecutive weeks (TI8) during the Core Period.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2a: Proportion of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), and AEs Leading to Discontinuation During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. An SAE is any AE or suspected adverse reaction that results in death, is immediately life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant incapacity or substantial disruption of the ability to conduct normal life functions, results in congenital anomaly/birth defect, or is considered an important medical event.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2a: Proportion of Participants With Laboratory Abnormalities During the Core Period
Phase 2a: Proportion of Participants With Hb 1.0+ Response
secondaryOutcomes.description: Hb 1.0+ response is defined as a ≥1.0-g/dL increase from baseline in the average Hb concentration from Week 8 through Week 16

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2a: Change From Baseline in Hb Concentration During the Core Period
Phase 2a: Proportion of Participants With ≥1.5-g/dL increase From Baseline in the Hb Concentration at ≥2 Consecutive Time Points From Week 8 through Week 16
Phase 2a: Change from Baseline in Total Transfused Red Blood Cell (RBC) Units During the Core Period
Phase 2a: Proportion of Participants With ≥50% Reduction in Total Transfused RBC Units for ≥8 Consecutive Weeks During the Core Period Compared With Baseline
Phase 2a: Plasma Concentration of Tebapivat During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Day 1 and Week 8 (≤60 minutes predose and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 hours postdose) and at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 16 (≤60 minutes predose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2a: Maximum (Peak) Concentration (Cmax) of Tebapivat During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Day 1 and Week 8 (≤60 minutes predose and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 hours postdose) and at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 16 (≤60 minutes predose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2a: Time to Cmax (tmax) of Tebapivat During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Day 1 and Week 8 (≤60 minutes predose and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 hours postdose) and at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 16 (≤60 minutes predose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2a: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From 0 to t Hours (AUC0-t) of Tebapivat During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Day 1 and Week 8 (≤60 minutes predose and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 hours postdose) and at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 16 (≤60 minutes predose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2a: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From 0 to the End of the Dosing Interval (AUC0-τ) of Tebapivat During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Day 1 and Week 8 (≤60 minutes predose and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 hours postdose) and at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 16 (≤60 minutes predose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2a: Apparent Terminal Elimination Half-life (t½) of Tebapivat During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Day 1 and Week 8 (≤60 minutes predose and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 hours postdose) and at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 16 (≤60 minutes predose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2a: Whole Blood Concentrations of 2,3-diphosphoglycerate (2,3-DPG) During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Day 1 and Week 8 (≤60 minutes predose and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 hours postdose) and at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 16 (≤60 minutes predose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2a: Whole Blood Concentrations of Adenosine Triphosphate (ATP) During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Day 1 and Week 8 (≤60 minutes predose and 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, and 8 hours postdose) and at Weeks 2, 4, 12, and 16 (≤60 minutes predose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2b: Proportion of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs), Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), and AEs Leading to Discontinuation During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. An SAE is any AE or suspected adverse reaction that results in death, is immediately life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant incapacity or substantial disruption of the ability to conduct normal life functions, results in congenital anomaly/birth defect, or is considered an important medical event.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2b: Proportion of Participants With Laboratory Abnormalities During the Core Period
Phase 2b: Change From Baseline in Hb Concentration During the Core Period
Phase 2b: Change From Baseline in Total Transfused RBC Units From Week 8 Through Week 24
Phase 2b: Proportion of Participants With ≥50% Reduction in Total Transfused RBC Units for ≥8 Consecutive Weeks During the Core Period Compared With Baseline
Phase 2b: Time to First TI8 During the Core Period
Phase 2b: Proportion of Participants Who Become Transfusion-free for ≥12 Consecutive Weeks (TI12) During the Core Period
Phase 2b: Proportion of Participants With ≥50% Reduction in Total Transfused RBC Units for ≥12 Consecutive Weeks During the Core Period Compared With Baseline
Phase 2b: Time to First TI12 During the Core Period
Phase 2b: Duration of Transfusion Independence (TI)
secondaryOutcomes.description: The duration of TI will be calculated as the number of days in the longest transfusion-free period starting on or after the start of study treatment through the end of the Core Period.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2b: Plasma Concentration of Tebapivat During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Predose and multiple time points post dose from Day 1 up to Week 20

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2b: Maximum (Peak) Concentration (Cmax) of Tebapivat During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Predose and multiple time points post dose from Day 1 up to Week 20

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2b: Time to Cmax (tmax) of Tebapivat During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Predose and multiple time points post dose from Day 1 up to Week 20

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2b: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From 0 to t Hours (AUC0-t) of Tebapivat During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Predose and multiple time points post dose from Day 1 up to Week 20

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2b: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From 0 to the End of the Dosing Interval (AUC0-τ) of Tebapivat During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Predose and multiple time points post dose from Day 1 up to Week 20

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2b: Apparent Terminal Elimination Half-life (t½) of Tebapivat During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Predose and multiple time points post dose from Day 1 up to Week 20

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2b: Whole Blood Concentrations of 2,3-diphosphoglycerate (2,3-DPG) During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Predose and multiple time points post dose from Day 1 up to Week 20

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Phase 2b: Whole Blood Concentrations of Adenosine Triphosphate (ATP) During the Core Period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Predose and multiple time points post dose from Day 1 up to Week 20
